formulas.name: Power Set
formulas.description: Number of subsets of a set with n elements, including empty set and the set itself

formulas.name: Union Count (Inclusion-Exclusion)
formulas.description: Count of elements in union of two sets

formulas.name: De Morgan's Law 1
formulas.description: Complement of union equals intersection of complements

formulas.name: De Morgan's Law 2
formulas.description: Complement of intersection equals union of complements

formulas.name: Number of Relations
formulas.formula: From set A to set B: 2^(|A|×|B|)
formulas.description: Each element of A×B either belongs to relation or not

formulas.name: Number of Functions
formulas.description: Each element of A maps to exactly one element of B

formulas.name: Reflexive Relation
formulas.formula: (a, a) ∈ R for all a ∈ A
formulas.description: Every element is related to itself

formulas.name: Symmetric Relation
formulas.description: If a is related to b, then b is related to a

formulas.name: Transitive Relation
formulas.formula: (a, b) ∈ R and (b, c) ∈ R ⟹ (a, c) ∈ R

formulas.name: Equivalence Relation
formulas.description: All three properties required. Equivalence relations partition the set into disjoint classes.

formulas.name: One-One (Injective) Function
formulas.description: Different inputs give different outputs. No two elements map to same value.

formulas.name: Onto (Surjective) Function
formulas.description: Every element in codomain has at least one preimage

formulas.name: Bijective Function
formulas.description: Bijective functions are invertible. |A| = |B| required for bijection between finite sets.

formulas.name: Inverse Function
formulas.description: To find inverse: set y=f(x), solve for x, swap x and y

formulas.name: Composition of Functions
formulas.description: Apply g first, then f. NOT commutative: f∘g ≠ g∘f in general.

formulas.name: Number of Surjections
formulas.formula: Σ(−1)^k × nCk × (n−k)^m for A(m elements) to B(n elements)
